title: 111_s3484
content:
The "Secure Federal File Sharing Act" is the short title of the Act. It outlines the requirements that need to be met. The "Secure Federal File Sharing Act" mandates guidance on prohibiting the use of certain peer-to-peer file sharing software on Federal computers and networks, including those used by contractors. It also addresses the use of such software on personal computers for telework purposes. The "Secure Federal File Sharing Act" requires the development of a procedure for approving specific peer-to-peer file sharing software for Government employees and contractors if it is necessary for agency operations or supports the agency's mission. The "Secure Federal File Sharing Act" mandates agencies to establish personal use policies consistent with guidance, require contractors to comply with the guidance, and update their IT systems within 180 days of enactment. Direct agencies to update IT security and ethics training policies for all employees, including contractors, to comply with guidance and prevent prohibited file sharing software on Federal computers and networks. SEC. 3. ANNUAL REPORT.

The Director of the Office of Management and Budget must submit an annual report to specific congressional committees on the implementation of the Act, including justifications for approved peer-to-peer file sharing software and a list of agencies using such programs. Nothing in this section requires disclosure of confidential government operations or investigations.

SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. In this Act, the term "agency" refers to various government entities in the executive branch, including independent regulatory agencies and government-owned contractor-operated facilities. The term "open-network" in relation to software describes a network that allows for certain functionalities. Peer-to-peer file sharing software refers to a program that allows files on one computer to be shared and copied to other computers. It is commercially marketed and typically lacks security measures. Peer-to-peer file sharing software allows files to be copied to another computer without requiring any action by the owner or authorized user of the computer on which the program is installed. Peer-to-peer file sharing software allows users to search and copy files from other computers using compatible programs, applications, or software. It excludes programs designed for Internet servers, email, messaging, or network services. The term "contractor" refers to a prime contractor or subcontractor as defined by the Federal Acquisition Regulation. This includes providing network or computer security, network management, maintenance, diagnostics, technical support, or repair.
